Testing a direct port is much easier than testing a newly developed game by itself, because you have the source of the port as a reference. You can simply check off, one by one, all the areas where the port is supposed to behave exactly like the source. If it doesn't behave that way, it won't stand up to being tested. Additionally, porting a PC title to a console is much easier than the other way round, because there is only one hardware configuration to worry about as opposed to several million. You can have an incredibly in-depth test focused on exactly the one use case that will be guaranteed to happen at the customer's house, instead of spreading your resources in an effort to catch only the most common issues on as many platform variations as possible.

As such, I'm not really worried about the beta testing being carried out inhouse.

This is a baseless assumption.
